result.execSummary:
The defendant William Anthony Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. William Anthony Jackson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • William Anthony Jackson was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All court costs, surcharges to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Absolutely no contact with victim Sukima D. unless authorized by DOC or the Court.
*10/21/2015  Term of Extended Supervision commuted to five (5) years.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor; and that that voting privileges are suspended

charges.descr: Endangering Safety by Use of Dangerous Weapon (Discharge Within 100 Yards of a Building)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William Anthony Jackson

records.addlTxt: Signed, Filed, and Distributed; Decision and Order Denying Motion for Sentence Modification.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Cynthia Davis, Branch 21, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se motion to modify sentence (correct the JOC with regard to WSAP eligibility).

Certification of transcript of proceedings of SENTENCING commencing SEPTEMBER 22, 2015 received and filed. (23 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to STATUTE REQUIRES.

AMENDING Judgments of Conviction signed and filed.
The term of extended supervision in 15CF1586 and 15CF2202 is commuted to five years.  All other sentencing orders entered on 9-22-2015 shall remain in full force and effect.
Request for payment of $17 witness fees for witness Sukimi D D for Tavarious E N (minor)  processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26214223 in court 1x on  9/28/15.
Request for payment of $17 witness fees for witness Sukimi D D for Malika A D (minor)  processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26214223 in court 1x on  9/28/15.
Request for payment of $17 witness fees for witness Sukimi D D  processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26214223 in court 1x on  9/28/15.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Wagner, Br. 38, for review. mag
DOC request to clarify length of extended supervision in 15CF001586 and 15CF002202.
Associated with Charge #4

Defendant William Anthony Jackson in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Defendant William Anthony Jackson in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  Statements by state, defense, defendant and additional statement by Sukimi D.
As to count 1:    The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 156 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 4 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 6 YEARS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-ABSOLUTE NO CONTACT WITH VICTIM, Sukima D unless authorized by Department of Corrections or the court.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and is to advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant is remanded and is to report to Dodge Correctional.
Filed: Pretrial Credit and Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence. (Filed in 15CF1586)

Defendant William Anthony Jackson in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Defendant William Anthony Jackson in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for final pre-trial however, parties have reached a resolution. 
As to Count 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

As to Count 2, 3, and 4:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered Counts 2, 3, and 4 dismissed.

Court ordered the jury trial date of 09/28/2015 vacated. 

Discussion regarding the defendant's communication privileges.  Court will not change the communication order.

Court ordered the defendant remanded pending sentencing.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge KREMERS.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Wagner, Br. 38.

Defendant William Anthony Jackson in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State's motion for joinder of 15CF1586 & 15CF2202 is GRANTED.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Jeff Szcewski for Christopher Paul Ehrfurth in court, defendant William Anthony Jackson not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests a status conference date.   Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffery Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Case set for Status Conference to address joinder and substitution. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant William Anthony Jackson not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. For reasons placed on the record Defense counsel motioned the court to withdraw as counsel. GRANTED by the court. Defense counsel to advised SPD office to appoint new counsel, and turnover discovery to the state on 7/9/15 at 1:30 PM in branch 23. Case set for a Status of Counsel date in branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant William Anthony Jackson in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant William Anthony Jackson in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Status Conference with pending case set for Arraignment. Discussion regarding communication privileges. Court advised that there is NO restriction as to communication privileges between the defendant and Attorney Thomas E. Harris. Case 15CF2202 & 15CF1586 Case is adjourned for a status conference in branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

State's motion to rescind defendant's phone, mail and visitation privileges heard.  For reasons stated on the record, Court granted the motion.  Court order Rescinding Defendant's telephone, Visitiation and US Mail Custody Privileges signed and filed.

Defendant William Anthony Jackson in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant William Anthony Jackson in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
BRANCH 40 FOR BRANCH 23.  
Information filed.  Defense counsel waived reading of the Information and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant William Anthony Jackson not in court, in custody.  Ben Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Arraignment. Court is in Jury Trial, case is adjourned off the record for an arraignment in branch 23. Signed & Filed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date.  Arraignment scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
FILED, DEMAND FOR DISCOVERY AND INSPECTION

Defendant William Anthony Jackson in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant William Anthony Jackson in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  City of Milwaukee Police Officer Terrell Byfield, City of Milwaukee Police Officer Ryan Carpenter.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Discovery turned over to defense.  Matter adjourned for an Arraignment/Motion Hearing.  Arraignment scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Reduction of Bail received and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with:   Sukimi D; TCN (dob: 8/15/99); DDL (dob: 10/7/2005); MAD (dob: 10/22/1999).
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Amended Complaint received andfiled. 
AS TO COUNT 4 ONLY: Attempting to Flee or Elude A Traffic Office.  contrary to sec 346.04(3), 939.50(3)(i) Wis. Stats.

Defendant William Anthony Jackson in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant William Anthony Jackson in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Defendants pleads Not Guilty as to Misdemeanor Counts  2 and 3. 
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
